availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. McDonald (Ballard County master tailor and soldier)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, master tailor and soldier. Married to Sarah E. McDonald. Father of Nancy McDonald. Master tailor in Ballard County in 1860. Served in the 8th Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a private from September 13, 1862 to September 23, 1863. Served in the Ballard County Militia (Kentucky National Legion) as lieutenant in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Milburn, p. 650.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0091.
